consents.sanitasPatient: I am a patient of Sanitas. By signing this form, I give my consent to be treated by the clinical providers of this practice.
consents.services: I understand treatment and services may include:
consents.tests: I am a patient of Sanitas. By signing below, I give my consent to be treated by Sanitas healthcare providers.
consents.exams: I understand treatment and services may include: lab tests, routine exams, screening tests (tests that can find an illness early, before a person shows signs of having the disease), diagnostic tests (tests that shows if a person has a certain illness or health problem).
consents.screening: I understand that no promises have been made to me about the results of any treatment or services.
consents.diagnostic: I understand that I have the right to refuse any treatment or procedure and have the right to discuss all medical treatments with my provider.
consents.recognize: I acknowledge that I have read and understood each of the above provisions appearing in this section. I have also had the opportunity to ask any questions, and by my signature, I consent and agree to such provisions individually and collectively. A copy may be used in lieu of the original.
consents.ConsentTreatmentOfMinor: Consent for Treatment of Minor or Incapacitated Patient. As the Personal Representative of the minor or incapacitated patient, I hereby give consent for the Patient to receive medically necessary treatment and care, including emergency treatment, by Sanitas. We reserve the right to require proper identification of the Personal Representative prior to the provision of treatment and care to a minor or incapacitated patient.
consents.acknowledge: I acknowledge that I have read and understood each of the above provisions appearing on this page.
consents.consent: I have also had the opportunity to ask any questions, and by my signature, I consent and agree to such provisions individually and collectively. A copy may be used in lieu of the original.
consents.timeTo: From time to time, Sanitas and its affiliates desire to contact patients and other individuals via emails, phone calls, text messages, prerecorded messages or voicemails to:
consents.l1: By providing my phone number and email address, I voluntarily and expressly authorize Sanitas (or third parties acting on behalf of Sanitas and subject to patient confidentiality restrictions) to communicate with me at the phone number and email address that I provided above, using automated/autodialed phone calls, prerecorded messages, artificial voices, voicemail, automated SMS (text) messages and email for information related to my treatment and care as well as marketing purposes for healthcare products and services recommended by Sanitas which may be beneficial to Sanitas patients. I understand that such communications may not be encrypted or secure. Sanitas will use appropriate safeguards to protect my PHI in accordance with HIPAA and relevant laws. Message and data rates may apply.
consents.such: Such communications may contain your protected health information. Although Sanitas works hard to protect your personal health information, please know that no electronic mode of communication or transmission of information can be completely secure, and there is no guarantee that your electronically transmitted information will not be compromised.
consents.consentComunication2: by using the opt-out mechanism provided in the communication. I understand that

consents.consentComunication4: confirm that I own or control the phone number and email provided by me and agree to notify Sanitas in writing within thirty (30) days if I change my phone number or email address.
consents.consentComunicationBol1: I have the right to opt out of receiving future Sanitas communications at any time
consents.consentComunicationBol2: I may revoke this consent for communications at any time
consents.consentComunicationBol3: I am not required to sign this consent as a condition to receiving treatment or services from Sanitas and that opting out of Sanitas communications will not affect my treatment or the services available to me. I
consents.notice: Notice of Privacy Practice. I acknowledge that I have received the practice’s Notice of Privacy Practice, which describes the ways in which the practice may use and disclose my healthcare information for its treatment, payment, healthcare operations and other described and permitted uses and disclosures. I understand that I may contact the office if I have a question or complaint. To the extent permitted by law, I consent to the use and disclosure of my information for the purposes described in the practice’s Notice of Privacy Practices.
consents.release: Release of Information. I hereby permit the practice and the physicians or other health professionals involved in my care to release healthcare information for the purposes of treatment, payment, or healthcare operations, or as allowed by law.
consents.patientAcknow: Patient HIPAA acknowledement &  health information exchange OPT-IN
consents.noticeOfPrivacy: Notice of Privacy Practices. I acknowledge that I have received the Sanitas Notice of Privacy Practices(https://www mysanitas.com/en/legal/notice-privacy-practices), which describes my rights and Sanitas' duties with respect to my protected health information (“PHI”), and specifically notifies me that Sanitas is authorized to use, disclose, receive and exchange my PHI for (i) purposes of treatment, payment and healthcare operations; (ii) as authorized by written; and (iii) as permitted by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPPA) regulations by (collectively, the “Permitted Uses”) I understand that I may contact the Privacy Officer (contact@mysanitas.com) if I have any questions or complaints. To the extent permitted by law, I consent voluntarily use, disclose, receive and share my PHI for the purposes described in the Notice of Privacy Practices.

consents.noticeOfPrivacy2: ) which describes my rights and Sanitas' dutieswith respect to my protected health information (my 'PHI'), and specifically notifies me that Sanitas is permitted to use, disclose, receive and exchange my PHI for (i) treatment, payment and healthcare operations purposes; (ii) as I may authorize in writing; and (iii) as otherwise allowed pursuant to the regulations of the HealthInsurance Portability and Accountability Act ('HIPAA') and relevant state laws (collectively, the 'Permitted Uses'). consents.pround: Sanitas is proud to be an Academic Center for healthcare students. With your consent, as part of the program, a student may be invited to speak to you about your visit and/or overall health before you are seen by your physician. Critical to the experience is the awareness and education of the importance of patient’s privacy and confidentiality.
consents.asResult: As a result, all students participating in this program will have completed HIPAA compliance training, signed an agreement to adhere to the Sanitas Code of Conduct, and will have signed an agreement of confidentiality, prior to commencing, as to ensure that your patient rights are protected.
consents.theDoc: The doctors and the healthcare providers of Sanitas charge fees for the care provided to you. The fees may not be the same as the estimate given. This includes any deductibles and coinsurances. Copays are due at the time of service. You are also responsible for any deductibles and coinsurances on your insurance plan.
consents.copays: In the event your health insurance company does not pay the full amount of fees charged by Sanitas, you (patient or responsible party) would have to pay Sanitas for the cost of care not paid by the health insurance company. This also applies for patients within their grace period.
consents.insurance: If the insurance information provided to Sanitas is not correct, you may have to pay the fees associated with your care.
consents.noInsurance: If you do not have health insurance, then you will have to pay the fees for the medical services rendered to you.
consents.medicare: Medicare will only pay for the care that is acceptable and needed under section 19862(a)(1) of the Medicare Law. By signing below, you certify the facts you have given to Sanitas for payment under Tittle XVIII and XIX of the Social Security Act are correct.

My refusal will not affect my treatment or the services available to me. If I prefer not to be photographed, I will be asked to provide photo identification at each visit. With your consent, as part of the program, a student may be invited to speak to you about your visit and/or overall health before you are seen by your physician. consents.medicalInformation: Health information exchanges (“HIEs) allow your PHI, from all sources of treatment, to be available, viewed and transmitted electronically by your providers and care teams. Accessing HIEs with respect to your PHI will meet the requirements under HIPAA and relevant state laws. I understand that Sanitas participates in one or more HIEs.

termsEnglish.textEnglish1:
Welcome to the mySanitas Healthcare Application (hereinafter referred to as the “App” or “mySanitas App”), owned, operated, and licensed by Keralty S.A.S., a sociedad por acciones simplificada (“Keralty S.A.S.”), whose principal place of business is Bogotá D.C., Colombia and who controls, directly or indirectly, a group of companies duly established in different countries, including the United States of America and different states in the United States of America, that provide healthcare services through medical centers and other health institutions and products (“Keralty’s Business Group”).

In the United States of America, Sanitas USA, Inc. (“Sanitas USA”) and Sanitas USA II Inc. (“Sanitas USA II”) have been duly established as Special Purpose Vehicles (“SPV”) by the parent company Keralty S.A.S. and one of its affiliates Compañia de Medicina Prepagada Colsanitas S.A., in order to expand the Keralty S.A.S. Comprehensive Health Model  in the United States of America (“Keralty’s USA Business Group”), through: (i) incorporating entities fully owned by Sanitas USA or Sanitas USA II or any of their affiliates; (ii) forming joint ventures between Keralty’s USA Business Group and certain health care organizations, payors, or providers, and; (iii) entering into management services agreements by and between such joint ventures and Health Care Professional Corporations/Associations across different states of the United States of America, to provide managerial services (“Keralty S.A.S.” and “Keralty’s Business Group” and “Keralty´s USA Business Group” shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as “Keralty” or “We” or “Us” or “Our”).

The mySanitas App, as part of Keralty’s digital concierge platform (the “Digital Concierge Platform”), has been developed as a personalized healthcare administrator for individual users (patients) receiving healthcare related information and services through Keralty’s USA Business Group as a member of one of its care networks (each a “Sanitas Care Network” herein).

The mySanitas App is offered to users (hereinafter referred to individually as a “User”, collectively as “Users” or as “You” or “Your”) for download conditioned on User’s acceptance without modification of the Agreement and all of the terms, conditions, and notices contained herein (collectively the “Terms”).

BY TAPPING THE “READ AND ACCEPTED” BUTTON IN THE APP, USERS AGREE TO BE BOUND BY THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THIS AGREEMENT. PLEASE READ THIS ENTIRE AGREEMENT CAREFULLY BEFORE ACCEPTING ITS TERMS.  WHEN YOU CLICK THE READ AND  ACCEPTED  BUTTON, YOU AGREE TO ACCEPT THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE.

The mySanitas App is a mobile application and therefor by design, all communications and documentation relating to the mySanitas App and its Services and features will be completely paperless and only furnished to You electronically and require that You have access to (i) a smartphone or android device capable of supporting the mySanitas App; (ii) a current version of the mySanitas App; and (iii) a wireless network or other internet enabled network.  By accepting these Terms and using the mySanitas App you are consenting to send/receive communications electronically and to use electronic signatures hereunder.

Please read carefully these Terms and Our

(the “Privacy Policy”) which is incorporated by reference into these Terms.  If You do not agree to these Terms and/or Privacy Policy, You have no right to continue using Our App.  Failure to use the mySanitas App in accordance with these Terms may subject You to civil and criminal penalties.  This App reserves the right to recover the cost of services, collect service charges, and recover damages and lawyer’s fees from persons using the mySanitas App fraudulently. We may at any time revise these Terms via an update in the App.  You agree to be bound by subsequent revisions and agree to review the Terms periodically for changes.  The most up to date version of the Terms will always be available for Your review under the “Terms of Use” link that appears at the bottom of the mySanitas App.

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS CAREFULLY AS THEY CONTAIN IMPORTANT INFORMATION REGARDING YOUR LEGAL RIGHTS, REMEDIES, AND OBLIGATIONS. THESE INCLUDE VARIOUS DISCLAIMERS, LIMITATIONS AND EXCLUSIONS, AND A CLAUSE THAT GOVERNS THE JURISDICTION AND VENUE OF DISPUTES.

IN USING THIS APP YOU ARE DEEMED TO HAVE READ AND AGREED TO THESE TERMS, AND ANY INCIDENTAL DOCUMENTS AND LINKS MENTIONED SHALL BE CONSIDERED TO BE ACCEPTED JOINTLY WITH THESE TERMS.  YOU AGREE TO USE THE APP ONLY IN STRICT INTERPRETATION AND ACCEPTANCE OF THESE TERMS AND ANY ACTIONS OR COMMITMENTS MADE WITHOUT REGARD TO THESE TERMS SHALL BE AT YOUR OWN RISK.  THESE TERMS FORM PART OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE RESPECTIVE USERS AND US.  BY DOWNLOADING AND USING THIS APP AND/OR UNDERTAKING TO RECEIVE A SERVICE BY US INDICATES YOUR UNDERSTANDING, AGREEMENT TO AND ACCEPTANCE, OF THE DISCLAIMER NOTICE AND THE FULL TERMS CONTAINED HEREIN.

THE mySANITAS APP IS NOT INTENDED FOR USE IN EMERGENCIES.  NEVER USE THE mySANITAS APP IN AN ACTUAL MEDICAL EMERGENCY. 	CALL 911 FOR ALL MEDICAL EMERGENCIES	. 

1. DEFINITIONS:
	1.1	“Agreement” means these Terms and the Privacy Policy, together with all Exhibits and other policies published on the mySanitas App, each as may be amended, negated, supplemented, varied or replaced from time to time.

	1.2	 “Services” means and refers to those features of Our App (such as patient registration, check your symptoms, personalized care programs, talk to a doctor, personal health records, physician televisits, notifications, remote monitoring, sync your device, and more) that enable Users to remotely and electronically share their health status and protected health information in a secure way, facilitate communication with their medical providers and care team, and to take greater responsibility and control over their health to achieve an improved level of healthcare quality, efficiency, and most importantly outcomes.

En los Estados Unidos de América, Sanitas USA, Inc., (“Sanitas USA”) y Sanitas USA II Inc., (“Sanitas USA II”) han sido debidamente constituidas como Vehículos de Propósito Especial (“VPE”) por la sociedad matriz Keralty S.A.S. y una de sus filiales, Compañía de Medicina Prepagada Colsanitas S.A., con el fin de expandir el Modelo de Salud Integral de Keralty S.A.S. en los Estados Unidos de América (“Grupo Empresarial de Keralty en USA”), mediante: (i) la constitución de entidades de la propiedad total de Sanitas USA o Sanitas USA II o cualquiera de sus filiales; (ii) la formación de joint ventures entre empresas del Keralty USA Business Group y determinadas organizaciones del sector salud, aseguradores en salud o prestadores de servicios de salud y; (iii) la celebración de acuerdos de administración por y entre dichas joint ventures y las Corporaciones/Asociaciones de Profesionales de la Salud en diferentes estados de los Estados Unidos de América, para prestar servicios de gestión (“Keralty S.A.S.”, “Keralty Business Group” y “Keralty USA Business Group” se denominarán colectivamente de aquí en adelante “Keralty” o “Nosotros” o “Nos” o “Nuestro”).

14.2	Dichos esfuerzos incluirán, como mínimo, que los  ejecutivos de cada una de las Partes que tienen la responsabilidad de tomar decisiones hagan consultas entre ellos, se reúnan en persona o a través de videollamada(s) y negocien entre sí y de buena fe, reconociendo sus intereses mutuos, intenten alcanzar una solución justa y equitativa satisfactoria para ambas partes.

14.3	Si las partes no resuelven la Disputa según el párrafo anterior dentro de un período de 30 días, entonces, previa notificación de cualquiera de las partes a la otra, las partes acuerdan mediar la Disputa de buena fe de acuerdo con los Procedimientos de Mediación Comercial de la Asociación Americana de Arbitraje en el estado de la Florida o en otro lugar mutuamente acordado por las partes. Las partes trabajarán de buena fe con el mediador para intentar completar la mediación dentro de los 60 días siguientes a dicha notificación.

14.4	Si Keralty y Usted no resuelven la Disputa a través de la mediación, entonces, tras la notificación de cualquiera de las Partes a la otra, la Disputa se resolverá finalmente mediante un arbitraje administrado por la Asociación Americana de Arbitraje de acuerdo con las disposiciones de su Reglamento de Arbitraje Comercial. El arbitraje se llevará a cabo de forma confidencial. El arbitraje se llevará a cabo ante un único árbitro acordado por las partes. Cualquier decisión o laudo resultante de dicho procedimiento de arbitraje se hará por escrito y proporcionará una explicación de todas las conclusiones de hecho y de derecho, e incluirá la evaluación de los costos, los gastos y los honorarios razonables de los abogados. Todo arbitraje será llevado a cabo por un árbitro con experiencia en derecho contractual y tecnológico, incluirá un registro escrito de la audiencia de arbitraje y se llevará a cabo en Florida o en otro lugar si así lo acuerdan las partes. El laudo arbitral podrá ser confirmado por un tribunal de jurisdicción competente. El árbitro otorgará a una o ambas partes como parte prevaleciente en cualquier reclamación o defensa, si la hubiera, según lo determine el árbitro, algunos o todos sus costos y honorarios a su entera discreción. “Costos y honorarios” significa todos los gastos razonables previos al arbitraje, incluidos los honorarios de los árbitros, los honorarios administrativos, los gastos de bolsillo, como las fotocopias y el teléfono, los honorarios de los testigos y los honorarios de los abogados.

18. PRIVACIDAD:

19. SEGURIDAD:

Hemos empleado las mayores medidas de seguridad posibles para proteger sus datos almacenados con nosotros. Si bien tomamos todas las medidas posibles, Usted debe notificarnos inmediatamente cuando tenga conocimiento de cualquier acceso no autorizado, cualquier actividad ilegal en línea o cualquier otra violación de la seguridad relacionada con la Aplicación, Su Cuenta o Nuestros Servicios y hacer todo lo que esté bajo Su control para mitigar el acceso no autorizado o la violación de la seguridad (incluyendo proporcionarnos las pruebas y notificar a las autoridades correspondientes). No seremos responsables de ninguna pérdida o daño que se derive del acceso no autorizado a Su cuenta como consecuencia de que Usted no haya protegido Su contraseña.

Usted entiende que cualquier hecho relacionado con cualquier asunto cubierto por esta liberación podrá ser diferente a lo que ahora se considera que es cierto y Usted acepta y asume el riesgo de tales posibles diferencias de hecho. Además, Usted renuncia expresamente a todos los derechos y beneficios que pueda tener en virtud de cualquier otra ley estatal o federal o principio de derecho común de efecto similar, en la mayor medida permitida por la ley.

22.1	Cualquier notificación a Keralty debe enviarse por correo certificado con gastos de envío pagados previamente y con acuse de recibo, o por un servicio nacional de mensajería aérea de un día para otro a Nosotros en: Sanitas USA, Inc., 8400 NW 33rd Street, Suite #201, Doral, Florida 33122-1937 ATENCIÓN: General Counsel.

22.2	En Su caso, le enviaremos cualquier notificación a la dirección de correo electrónico que nos haya facilitado (bien sea durante el proceso de registro o cuando cambie su dirección de correo electrónico). La notificación se considerará realizada 24 horas después del envío del correo electrónico, a menos que se le notifique a la parte remitente que la dirección de correo electrónico no es válida. De forma alternativa, podemos enviarle una notificación por correo certificado, con gastos de envío pagados previamente y con acuse de recibo a la dirección que nos haya proporcionado. En tal caso, la notificación se considerará realizada tres días después de la fecha de envío.

23. NUESTRO SERVICIO Y GARANTÍAS:

Keralty se reserva el derecho de modificar o cancelar el servicio de la Aplicación por cualquier motivo sin previo aviso y en cualquier momento. También nos reservamos el derecho de vender, alterar, transferir o delegar Nuestros derechos bajo este acuerdo a cualquier persona sin darle a Usted previo aviso. Keralty no garantiza el acceso continuo e ininterrumpido a la Aplicación y el funcionamiento de la Aplicación podrá verse interferido por numerosos factores ajenos a nuestro control.

24. ENLACES A OTRAS APLICACIONES:

Los enlaces a “aplicaciones de terceros” en esta Aplicación, incluyendo específicamente, pero sin limitación a, aquellas que aceptan pagos de Usted para pagar (o realizar un “checkout”) por los bienes y servicios relacionados con la salud que Usted recibe como miembro/paciente de una Red de Atención Sanitas, se proporcionan únicamente para su conveniencia. Estas “aplicaciones de terceros” no son Aplicaciones de Terceros tal y como se definen anteriormente y si Usted utiliza estos enlaces, Usted será redirigido a un  nuevo navegador para acceder a la aplicación de terceros que Usted solicite.

NO HEMOS REVISADO ESTAS APLICACIONES DE TERCEROS Y NO CONTROLAMOS NI SOMOS RESPONSABLES DE NINGUNA DE ESTAS APLICACIONES NI DE SU CONTENIDO, NI DE SU POLÍTICA DE PRIVACIDAD NI DE SUS TÉRMINOS Y CONDICIONES. NO RESPALDAMOS NI HACEMOS NINGUNA DECLARACIÓN SOBRE ELLAS, NI SOBRE LA INFORMACIÓN, NI SOBRE OTROS PRODUCTOS O MATERIALES QUE SE ENCUENTREN EN ELLAS, NI SOBRE LOS RESULTADOS QUE PUEDAN OBTENERSE AL UTILIZARLAS. SI USTED DECIDE ACCEDER A CUALQUIERA DE LAS APLICACIONES DE TERCEROS VINCULADAS A ESTA APLICACIÓN, LO HARÁ BAJO SU PROPIA RESPONSABILIDAD.

Una de las aplicaciones de terceros disponibles para Usted es un sistema de pago en línea que admite la transferencia electrónica de dinero para el pago de los servicios sanitarios que reciba de una Red Sanitas Care.  Si lo desea, podrá acceder a este sistema de pago a través de un enlace de proveedores de servicios externos disponible en mySanitas App.  Para facilitar su pago, esta aplicación de terceros puede requerirle información sobre su tarjeta de pago, incluyendo su nombre, fecha de caducidad de la tarjeta, código de autenticación y dirección de facturación.

Usted declara y garantiza que, si efectúa pagos en línea, los datos de su tarjeta de crédito, tarjeta de débito o cuenta bancaria que facilite son veraces, exactos y completos, y que Usted es la persona a cuyo nombre se emitió la tarjeta, o que está autorizado por el emisor para utilizar la tarjeta de crédito o débito correspondiente y los datos de la tarjeta.

Cualquier queja o solicitud relativa al uso de su información financiera a través de un enlace de terceros debe dirigirse directamente al proveedor de servicios de terceros.

28. FUERZA MAYOR:

29. MODIFICACIÓN:

Estos Términos no podrán ser modificados de forma individual por ninguna persona afiliada, o que pretenda estar afiliada, con Nosotros. Nada de lo dispuesto en esta sección impedirá que modifiquemos estos Términos y que publiquemos dichas modificaciones en nuestra Aplicación. Nos reservamos el derecho, a nuestra única y exclusiva discreción, de revisar estos Términos en cualquier momento. Todas las revisiones se publicarán en esta página. Debido a que Usted está obligado a cumplir con todas las revisiones realizadas por Nosotros, Usted debe revisar esta página cada vez que se conecte a Nuestra Aplicación. Es importante que Usted lea y comprenda completamente los términos y condiciones a los que se compromete cuando utilice esta Aplicación.

30. COMUNICACIONES:

30.1	El equipo de nuestra Aplicación podrá enviarle información sobre ofertas, avisos, cartas y otras comunicaciones a su correo electrónico. Usted podrá pedirnos que nos abstengamos de enviarle ofertas o promociones enviándonos un correo electrónico o haciendo clic en el enlace de cancelación de la suscripción en Nuestros correos electrónicos enviados a Usted.

30.2	Usted da su consentimiento para recibir avisos e información de nuestra parte en relación con la Aplicación y los servicios mediante comunicación electrónica. Usted podrá retirar este consentimiento en cualquier momento, pero si lo hace podemos optar por suspender o cerrar su cuenta.

30.3	Al utilizar Nuestros servicios, se considera que Usted ha firmado este Acuerdo electrónicamente; con efectos a partir de la fecha en que registre Su Cuenta y comience a utilizar Nuestros servicios. El registro de su Cuenta constituye un reconocimiento de que podrá recibir, descargar e imprimir electrónicamente este Acuerdo.

30.4	En relación con este Acuerdo, Usted podrá tener derecho a recibir ciertos registros, como contratos, avisos y comunicaciones, por escrito. Para facilitar su uso de la Aplicación, nos da permiso para proporcionarle estos registros electrónicamente en lugar hacerlo en papel.

30.5	Al registrarse en una Cuenta, Usted da su consentimiento para recibir y acceder electrónicamente, a través del correo electrónico, a todos los registros y avisos de los servicios que se le prestan en virtud de este Contrato y que, de otro modo, tendríamos que proporcionarle en papel. Usted podrá retirar su consentimiento para recibir más registros y avisos por vía electrónica en cualquier momento poniéndose en contacto con Nosotros utilizando los datos de contacto proporcionados en Nuestra Aplicación. Si retira su consentimiento para recibir dichos registros y notificaciones electrónicamente, pondremos fin a su acceso a los Servicios y ya no podrá utilizarlos. Cualquier retirada de su consentimiento para recibir registros y notificaciones electrónicamente será efectiva sólo después de que tengamos un período de tiempo razonable para procesar su solicitud de retirada. Tenga en cuenta que el retiro de su consentimiento para recibir registros y notificaciones por vía electrónica no se aplicará a los registros y notificaciones que le hayamos proporcionado por vía electrónica antes de que la retirada de su consentimiento sea efectiva.

30.6	Con el fin de garantizar que podamos proporcionarle registros y notificaciones electrónicamente, debe notificarnos sobre cualquier cambio en su dirección de correo electrónico actualizando la información de su cuenta y poniéndose en contacto con el servicio de atención al cliente a través del correo electrónico

31. ADVERTENCIA ESPECIAL PARA USO INTERNACIONAL:

Reconociendo la naturaleza global de Internet, Usted se compromete a cumplir con todas las normas locales relacionadas con la conducta en línea y al Contenido aceptable. Específicamente, Usted se compromete a cumplir con todas las leyes aplicables relacionadas con la transmisión de datos técnicos exportados desde los Estados Unidos o el país en el que Usted reside.

32. ACUERDO COMPLETO:

En relación con las demás obligaciones, políticas y normas detalladas por escrito en la Aplicación, este Acuerdo constituye el acuerdo completo entre Usted y Keralty en relación con la Aplicación.

33. CONTÁCTENOS:

termsEspañol.textEspañol6:
34. RECOPILACIÓN AUTOMÁTICA DE INFORMACIÓN Y TECNOLOGÍAS DE SEGUIMIENTO:

34.1	Al descargar, acceder y utilizar MySanitas App, esta puede utilizar tecnología para recopilar automáticamente:

34.1.1	Detalles de uso. Cuando usted accede a la App y la utiliza, podemos recopilar automáticamente ciertos detalles de su acceso y uso de la App, incluidos datos de tráfico, datos de localización, registros, etc., datos de comunicación y los recursos a los que usted accede y utiliza en la App o a través de ella.

34.1.2	Información sobre dispositivos. Podemos recopilar información sobre su dispositivo móvil y su conexión a Internet, incluido el identificador único del dispositivo, la dirección IP, el sistema operativo, el tipo de navegador, la información de la red móvil y el número de teléfono del dispositivo.

34.1.3	Información y archivos almacenados. También podemos acceder a metadatos y otra información asociada a otros archivos almacenados en su dispositivo. Esto puede incluir, por ejemplo, fotografías, clips de audio y vídeo, contactos personales e información de la agenda.

34.2	Las tecnologías que utilizamos para la recopilación automática de información pueden incluir:

34.2.1	Cookies (o cookies móviles). Una cookie es un pequeño archivo que se coloca en su smartphone. Puede ser posible negarse a aceptar cookies móviles activando la configuración apropiada en su smartphone. No obstante, si selecciona esta configuración es posible que no pueda acceder a determinadas partes de nuestra App.

34.2.2	Web Beacons. Pequeños archivos electrónicos conocidos como web beacons (también denominados clear gifs, pixel tags y single-pixel gifs) que permiten a mySanitas App, por ejemplo, contabilizar los usuarios que han visitado la tienda, la página web y para otras estadísticas relacionadas con la app.

35. USO DE INTELIGENCIA ARTIFICIAL

Podemos utilizar automáticamente inteligencia artificial (IA) para mantener una conversación con Usted y prestarle el servicio requerido. En este sentido, la IA podría proporcionarle respuestas a sus preguntas de acuerdo con sus especificaciones. Usted inicia la conversación desde el momento en que escribe en la ventana de chat o cuando la IA ejecuta una acción, como proporcionar información a través de una integración o la apertura de una herramienta interactiva.

results.title: Vital signs scan
results.subTitle: Done! These are the results of your health checkup in just 30 seconds.
results.PulseRateSub: Pulse Rate is the number of times the user’s heart beats, expressed as a rate per minute.
results.BreathingFrequencySub: Breathing rate corresponds to the number of times the user inhales and exhales, expressed as a rate per minute.
results.SystolicBloodPressureSub: Systolic blood pressure is the peak pressure in subject's brachial arteries during the contraction of their heart muscle
results.DiastolicBloodPressureSub: Diastolic blood pressure is the amount of pressure in subject's brachial arteries when their heart muscle is relaxed
results.StressLevelSub: The score that quantifies the user’s mental stress level on a 5-point scale, from relaxed (Level 1) to overloaded (Level 5)
results.BodyMassIndexSub: Body Mass Index is a measure of an individual's tissue mass (muscle, fat, and bone) adjusted for height
results.FacialSkinAgeSub: It may be influenced by many factors such as fatigue level, the use of skincare or cosmetics products.
results.textInfo: Remember that you should consult with your treating physician if you believe you require a clinical diagnosis or treatment. This functionality does not diagnose, nor does it replace measurements taken by a biomedical device or the clinical judgment of a healthcare professional.

about.subTitle: Here’s more information about our new features and services

text.0: About the new mental health module
text.1:
Welcome to our mental health platform, where we are dedicated to supporting individuals on their mental health journey. Our platform offers a range of features and resources designed to help you improve your mental health and well-being.

Our mental health functionality includes a range of features,
text.2: including educational resources, grounding exercises, and scheduling tools.
text.3: Our educational resources provide information on a range of mental health topics, including stress, anxiety, and depression, and offer practical tips for improving your mental health. Our grounding exercises help you stay grounded in the present moment and our scheduling options make it easier to schedule appointments with Behavioral health professional.
text.4: Thank you for choosing our platform as your partner on your mental health journey. We look forward to supporting you every step of the way.

stinkingMH.screenSubtitle: Do you often find yourself engaging in negative self-talk? This can hold you back from reaching your full potential.
stinkingMH.screenSubtitle2: Select 3 of the most common stinking thinking and check if they apply to your current situation.
stinkingMH.step01: Let’s think about our thoughts. Identifying and changing unhelpful thinking is one of the main ways to help create lasting change.
stinkingMH.step02: The most important thing to remember when considering our thoughts is our perception. Perception is the act of giving meaning to things we see, hear, taste, smell, and feel.
stinkingMH.step03: When something happens, we perceive the event using our senses and form thoughts based on that perception. That means, thoughts are not always true.
stinkingMH.step04: Swipe right or left to explore different types of stinking thinking. Tap on the “Applies” button if you can relate to that certain type of thinking. You can select up to three types.
stinkingMH.step05: Let’s start checking on your shrinking thoughts!
stinkingMH.buttonReady: I already chose my types of thinking
stinkingMH.bodyStep2: When we are able to identify the unhelpful thoughts that are causing anxiety, we can then begin to confront them by asking new questions that change our perspective.
stinkingMH.bodyStep3: We offer a variety of treatment options, from individual therapy to support groups, to meet your unique needs. Additionally, our network of mental health professionals is available to provide you with personalized and effective treatment.
stinkingMH.footerStep4: We offer a variety of treatment options, from individual therapy to support groups, to meet your unique needs. Additionally, our network of mental health professionals is available to provide you with personalized and effective treatment.
stinkingMH.bodyStep5: Struggling with negative thinking is not easy but healing is possible. You are fully capable of making a difference in your behaviors, thoughts, and feelings. Just do not give up. As long as you take breath there is hope. We are here for you during your journey toward healing and we encourage you to reach out if you need support.

screenUnderstandingYourAnxiety.titleViewCards: How CBT helps with your anxiety
screenUnderstandingYourAnxiety.subTitleViewCards:
CBT focuses on understanding how your behaviors relate to your emotions and thoughts.
When we can understand how our anxiety works, we can start to make changes to feel better. 

The Cognitive Triangle is the center of CBT which theorizes that
screenUnderstandingYourAnxiety.subTitleViewCardsBold: the way you think impacts the way you feel and that affects the way you behave.
screenUnderstandingYourAnxiety.subTitleViewCardsTwo: This can work in any direction. The way you feel can affect what you’re thinking and what you do.

modalAllNothing.title: All or Nothing Thinking
modalAllNothing.subTitle: People and situations are only considered in black and white categories. If a situation falls short of perfect, it is a total failure.
modalAllNothing.subTitleTwo: Seeing a single negative event, such as a romantic rejection or a career reversal as a never-ending pattern of defeat by using words such as 'always' or 'never' when thinking about it.
modalAllNothing.subTitleThree: Picking out a single negative detail and dwelling on it exclusively. This kind of thinking ignores any evidence to the contrary.

onboardingMH.disLib: This library is intended to provide patients/users, access to up-to date health information. The information provided is not intended to replace the advice of a healthcare professional and is not a substitute for medical advice, diagnosis, treatment or telemedicine services. My Sanitas App does not operate or controls the library or its content and will not be responsible for any errors or omissions in the information provided, nor for any consequences that may arise from relying on the informationpresented.
onboardingMH.disclaimerSub: This self-management tool is intended to be used as a guide and support for individuals seeking to improve their mental health and wellbeing. It is not intended to replace professional advice, diagnosis, or treatment. The information provided in this tool is based on general principles and may not be applicable to every individual. The user should consult with a qualified healthcare provider before making any changes to their treatment plan or undertaking any new activities. The user assumes all responsibility and risk for their use of this tool.
onboardingMH.title: Welcome to our Mental Health Module!
onboardingMH.sub0: We understand that taking care of your mental health is just as important as taking care of your physical health. Here are some features that we offer to help support your mental well-being.
onboardingMH.sub1: We've curated a list of mental health resources, including hotlines and support groups, that you can access directly from the app.
onboardingMH.sub2: Writing down your thoughts and feelings can be a great way to process and reflect on them. Our grounding exercises allows you to jot down your thoughts and track your progress over time.
onboardingMH.sub3: Scheduling an appointment with a Behavioral health professional is an important step towards improving your mental well-being. Find and book appointment with a dedicated providers in your area.

sub4.1: Please note that the mental health functionality provided in our app
sub4.2: is not intended to serve as a substitute for professional mental health care.
sub4.3: Our app is designed to provide tools and resources to support your mental well-being on an ongoing basis. It is not equipped to handle crisis situations, and it is not a crisis line.

wellness.description: Track your health with smart devices

lobby.description: Welcome, we’re glad you’re here. Where do you want to take your health today?

category.steps: Step count is the number of steps you take throughout the day. Pedometers and digital activity trackers can help you determine your step count. These devices count steps for any activity that involves step-like movement, including walking, running, stair-climbing, cross-country skiing, and even movement as you go about your daily chores.
category.distance: An active lifestyle means you do physical activity throughout the day. Any activity that gets you up and moving is part of an active lifestyle. Physical activity includes exercise such as walking or lifting weights. It also includes playing sports.
category.calories: One approach is to add up the number of calories per serving of all the foods that you eat, and then plan your menus accordingly. You can buy books that list calories per serving for many foods. In addition, the nutrition labels on all packaged foods and beverages provide calories per serving information.
category.heartrate: A normal resting heart rate for adults ranges from 60 to 100 beats per minute. Generally, a lower heart rate at rest implies more efficient heart function and better cardiovascular fitness. For example, a well-trained athlete might have a normal resting heart rate closer to 40 beats per minute.
